articles.author: Surya Shankar
articles.description:
Docker Swarm is a clustering tool that turns a group of Docker hosts into a single virtual server. 
Docker Swarm ensures availability and high performance for your application by distributing it over the number of Docker hosts inside a cluster. 
Docker Swarm also allows you to increase the number of container instance for the same application. 
Docker Swarm is made up of two main components:
1-Manager Nodes / Master Nodes
2-Worker Nodes

Manager Nodes Manager nodes are used to handle cluster management tasks such as maintaining cluster state, scheduling services, and serving swarm mode HTTP API endpoints.
If any Manager node dies unexpectedly, other one can pick up the tasks and restore the services to a stable state.
Worker Nodes Worker nodes are used to execute containers. 
 
You can als‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Install and Configure Docker Swarm on Linux.

articles.author: Ridhwana Khan
articles.description:
Destructuring refers to the process of unpacking a small part of something from the main part. In Ruby, we use destructuring to conveniently extract multiple values from data stored in Arrays or Hashes. It provides a way for us to group or ungroup data and assign them to variables where needed. 
In this article we‚Äôre going to discuss destructuring for assignments, arrays and keyword args. We‚Äôll also touch on why you would utilize destructuring.
The most straightforward form of destructuring is through multiple assignments. This form of destructuring assigns the variables on the left to the values on the right in the order that they are provided. 
As an example:
a, b, c = 1, 2, 3

a => 1 
b => 2 
c => 3 

In the above example the variables on the left are assigned to the values on the right‚Ä¶
articles.title: Destructuring in Ruby

articles.author: Roy
articles.description:
What is AWS DynamoDB?


AWS DynamoDB is a fast, scalable, and fully managed NoSQL database service. It provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability. DynamoDB enables you to offload the administrative burden of operating and scaling a highly available database. It also provides consistent performance and availability at any scale.
One of the main advantages of DynamoDB over traditional relational databases is its performance. DynamoDB is designed to offer fast and predictable performance at any scale. It uses a unique partitioning scheme that allows it to distribute data across multiple servers while maintaining low latency and high throughput.
DynamoDB uses adaptive capacity to automatically adjust capacity in response to changing traffic patterns, so you never have ‚Ä¶
articles.title: DynamoDB Pros & Cons

Why TypeScript?


I have another article that explains a lot about TypeScript, what it is and how and why you should use it.
https://dev.to/omerwow/how-i-began-using-typescript-3noe
In a nutshell, the benefits of using TypeScript include:
Catching errors early in the development process.
Making code easier to understand and maintain.
Providing a better development experience, with features like autocompletion and type checking.
To create a new React application with TypeScript, use the following command:
npx create-react-app my-app --template typescript

That's it, the Create React App CLI will create a new app with TypeScript configured properly and you can get started right away.
If, however, you have an existing React app that you want to convert to TypeScript, you're going to need to d‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to use TypeScript with React

Dev.to is a great site, with a great community. It's grown rapidly over the years from it's beginnings in 2016, amassing over 5.2 million backlinks from almost 65 thousand domains and cemented itself as one of the most authoritative community sites around coding on the net. 
But why has it's organic traffic stalled and is it important?
Has Traffic Plateaued?

#1 - Dev.to & The Bloated Index

Notes, Exceptions and Caveats: If you find this beneficial and have an open-source or commercial project‚Ä¶
articles.title: 6 Things Dev.To Can Do To Improve Organic Traffic

articles.author: Elvis
articles.description:
Software development principles are a must-know for all software engineers that aim to achieve clean codes. Software evolves with time as new features are required, so it is necessary to build a maintainable, reliable and sustainable code.
SOLID principles are five basic principles for object-oriented programming design. They are set of rules to follow when designing a class structured software. These principles puts maintainability and extensibility into consideration as software evolves.
SOLID STANDS FOR :
S ‚Äî SINGLE-RESPONSILITY PRINCIPLE
O ‚Äî OPEN-CLOSED PRINCIPLE
L ‚Äî LISTOV SUBSTITUTION PRINCIPLE
I ‚Äî INTERFACE SEGREGATION PRINCIPLE
D ‚Äî DEPENCY INVERSION PRINCIPLE
The SOLID principles were first introduced by the famous Computer Scientist Robert J. Martin (a.k.a Uncle Bob) in his 2000 p‚Ä¶
articles.title: SOLID: Fundamental Principles of Software Development using PHP (1)

articles.author: Arowolo Ebine
articles.description:
THE BEST TWO WAYS TO SECURED YOUR WEB APP:
Validate User Inputs:
Accordingly, Injection-based attacks can come in so many ways; XSS, SQL injections, host header injection, and OS command injection are a few examples of these attacks.
Therefore, Injection-based attacks have over the years made their way into the OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) and SANS Top 25 CWE (Common Weakness Enumeration) many times.
So, in the web development, we need to validate all inputs before the application processes the data to mitigate injection-based attacks.
E.g., the phone number field, Password field, Name field, they must only accept an acceptable format with specific numeric and special characters.
Managing Application Secrets:
for example, You can use environment variables within the operating system to store this sensitive information, and we can use Node.js to call these environment variables.
However, there are instances where the application would require more than one variable instantiated. At this juncture, the only best way to manage secrets is to use the dotenv package.
so, you can easily install it using npm or Yarn as follows:
npm install dotenv
yarn add dotenv
Then, create a .env file at the project root and define all the secrets in that file.
NODE_ENV= develpment,
MONGODB_URL = "mongodb_url:uerbsf@kgeyfdop_jhf"
PORT = 3000
USERNAME=secret123
PASSWORD=secret123@

Finally, you can require and use these secrets in the application like below:
require('dotenv').config();

mongoose.connect({
host: process.env.PORT,
username: process.env.MONGODB_URL,
password: process.env.PASSWORD
})

Most importantly, make sure to include .env files in the .gitignore file to prevent them from being pushed to the Git repository.
articles.title: THE BEST TWO WAYS TO SECURED YOUR WEB APP

articles.author: Yevhen Bondar
articles.description:
In previous parts, we've deployed the Django web application to ECS and connected PostgreSQL to it. But now, we have to deploy application changes manually. In this part, we are going to automate this process with the following steps:

Add the build CI/CD stage to build a docker image and push it to the ECR.
Add the deploy CI/CD stage to update the application on AWS.
Let's start with creating a GitLab group and projects. Go to gitlab.com and register an account. 
Then create a GitLab group. A group is like a folder for projects. You can configure shared settings like access policy and CI variables for them.
Create projects for Django and Terraform in this group. Be‚Ä¶
articles.title: Deploying Django Application on AWS with Terraform. GitLab CI/CD

GNOME Ê≠£ËÆ°ÂàíÈÄöÁü•Áî®Êà∑ÂÖ∂Âõ∫‰ª∂ÂÆâÂÖ®Áä∂ÊÄÅÔºåÊù•‰øùÊä§‰∏çÂÆâÂÖ®ÁöÑÁ°¨‰ª∂„ÄÇ




ÂΩì‰Ω†Âú®ÊîØÊåÅ UEFI ÁöÑÁîµËÑë‰∏äÂÆâË£Ö Linux Êó∂Ôºå‰Ω†ÂøÖÈ°ªÁ¶ÅÁî®‚ÄúÂÆâÂÖ®ÂêØÂä®Secure Boot‚ÄùÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ÂêØÁî®ËØ•ÈÄâÈ°πÂêéÔºå‰∏çËÉΩ‰ΩøÁî®Áé∞Âú∫ USBLive USB¬†ÂêØÂä®„ÄÇ

‰∏Ä‰∫õ‰∏ªÊµÅÁöÑ Linux ÂèëË°åÁâàÊîØÊåÅÂÆâÂÖ®ÂêØÂä®Ôºå‰ΩÜÂØπ‰∫éËÆ∏Â§öÂÖ∂‰ªñÂèëË°åÁâàÔºà‰ª•ÂèäÊùøËΩΩÁöÑ Nvidia Á°¨‰ª∂ÔºâÊù•ËØ¥ÔºåÂÆÉÁöÑËÆæÁΩÆ‰ªçÁÑ∂ÂÖ∑ÊúâÊåëÊàòÊÄß„ÄÇ

ËôΩÁÑ∂‰∏ÄÂπ¥Âèà‰∏ÄÂπ¥ÔºåÊÉÖÂÜµ‰ºº‰πéÂπ∂Ê≤°ÊúâÊîπÂñÑÔºå‰ΩÜÊÄªÁöÑÊù•ËØ¥ÔºåÂÆâÂÖ®ÂêØÂä®ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂøÖ‰∏çÂèØÂ∞ëÁöÑ‰øùÊä§ÂäüËÉΩ„ÄÇ

Â§öÂπ¥Êù•ÔºåÊàë‰∏ÄÁõ¥‰ΩøÁî® Postfix Êù•ËææÂà∞Ëøô‰∫õÁõÆÁöÑ„ÄÇÂÆÉÂÖ∑ÊúâÂèØÊé•ÂèóÁöÑÁÆÄÂçïÈÖçÁΩÆ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊúÄËøëÊàëÂºÄÂßãÂñúÊ¨¢ VPNÔºàmullvadÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÊÉ≥Áü•ÈÅìÁöÑËØùÔºâÔºåËÄåÂú®¬†/etc/resolv.conf¬†ÂèëÁîüÂèòÂåñÊó∂‰ºöÂèòÂæóÊ∑∑‰π±Ôºà‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºå‰Ω†Âú® Postfix ÁöÑÊúçÂä°ÂêØÂä®ÂêéÊâçÂêØÂä® VPNÔºâ„ÄÇÊàëÊâæÂà∞‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈùûÂ∏∏ÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑÊõø‰ª£ÊñπÊ°àÔºöOpenSMTPD„ÄÇ

ÂÅáËÆæÊàëÊÉ≥Âú®‰ΩøÁî®¬†jao@gnu.org¬†ÂèëÈÄÅÁîµÂ≠êÈÇÆ‰ª∂Êó∂‰ΩøÁî® SMTP ÊúçÂä°Âô®¬†fencepost.gnu.orgÔºåËÄåÂú®ÊàëÁöÑ¬†From¬†Â§¥‰∏≠‰ΩøÁî®¬†mail@jao.io¬†Êàñ¬†news@xmobar.org¬†Êó∂‰ΩøÁî®¬†smtp.jao.io„ÄÇOpenSMTPD ËÆ©‰Ω†ÈÄöËøá‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈùûÂ∏∏ÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑÈÖçÁΩÆÊñá‰ª∂¬†/etc/smtpd.conf¬†Êù•ÂÆûÁé∞Ôºö

ÔºàËøôÊòØÊàëÁöÑ Debian Êú∫Âô®‰∏≠ÁöÑÈªòËÆ§ÈÖçÁΩÆÊñá‰ª∂„ÄÇÂè¶‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊµÅË°åÁöÑÊõø‰ª£ÊñπÊ°àÊòØ¬†/etc/openstmpd.confÔºâ„ÄÇ

table aliases file:/etc/aliases
table secrets db:/etc/mail/secrets.db

table sendergnu { jao@gnu.org }
table senderjao { mail@jao.io, news@xmobar.org }

listen on localhost

action "local" mbox alias <aliases>
action "relaygnu" relay host smtp+tls://gnu@fencepost.gnu.org:587 auth <secrets>
action "relayjao" relay host smtps://jao@smtp.jao.io:465 auth <secrets>

match for local action "local"
match for any from mail-from <sendergnu> action "relaygnu"
match for any from mail-from <senderjao> action "relaygan"


Êàë‰ª¨Ëøò‰∏∫Ê≠§ÈÖçÁΩÆ‰∫ÜÊú¨Âú∞ÊäïÈÄí„ÄÇËøôÊòØÂÆåÊï¥ÁöÑÈÖçÁΩÆÊñá‰ª∂ÔºÅÂîØ‰∏ÄÈúÄË¶ÅÁöÑÂè¶‰∏Ä‰ª∂‰∫ãÊòØÁîüÊàê¬†secrets.db¬†Êñá‰ª∂ÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠ÂåÖÂê´‰∏éÈîÆ¬†gnu¬†Âíå¬†jao¬†ÂØπÂ∫îÁöÑÁî®Êà∑ÂíåÂØÜÁ†ÅÔºàËøô‰∫õÂè™ÊòØ‰ªªÊÑèÂêçÁß∞Ôºâ„ÄÇ‰∏∫Ê≠§ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰ΩøÁî®ÂÆÉ‰ª¨ÂàõÂª∫‰∏Ä‰∏™Á∫ØÊñáÊú¨Êñá‰ª∂Ôºå‰ΩøÁî®ÂΩ¢Âºè‰∏∫¬†<key> <user>:<password>¬†ÁöÑÊù°ÁõÆÔºö

ÂΩìÊàë‰∏∫È°πÁõÆÁºñÂÜôÊñáÊ°£Êó∂ÔºåÊàëÁªèÂ∏∏‰ª•Á∫ØÊñáÊú¨ÁöÑÂΩ¢ÂºèÁºñÂÜôËá™Ëø∞Êñá‰ª∂ÂíåÂÆâË£ÖËØ¥Êòé„ÄÇÊàë‰∏çÈúÄË¶Å‰ΩøÁî® HTML ÊàñËÄÖ Markdown ‰πãÁ±ªÁöÑÊ†áËÆ∞ËØ≠Ë®ÄÊù•ÊèèËø∞È°πÁõÆÁöÑÂäüËÉΩÊàñÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÁºñËØëÂÆÉ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊòØÁª¥Êä§ËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑÊñáÊ°£ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÂæàÁóõËã¶„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÊàëÈúÄË¶ÅÊõ¥Êñ∞ÊàëÁöÑ¬†Readme¬†Êñá‰ª∂‰∏≠ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™Âè•Â≠êÁöÑ‰∏≠Èó¥‰ΩçÁΩÆÔºåÊàëÈúÄË¶ÅÈáçÊñ∞Ê†ºÂºèÂåñÊñáÊú¨Ôºå‰ª•ÈÅøÂÖçÂú®ÊàëÁöÑÂÖ∂ÂÆÉÊñáÊú¨‰∏≠Èó¥Âá∫Áé∞‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂæàÈïøÊàñÂæàÁü≠ÁöÑË°åÔºåËÄåÂÖ∂ÂÆÉÁöÑË°åÁöÑÊ†ºÂºèÊòØÊï¥Êï¥ÈΩêÈΩêÁöÑ 75 Âàó„ÄÇ‰∏Ä‰∫õÁºñËæëÂô®ÂåÖÂê´ÂèØ‰ª•Ëá™Âä®ÈáçÊñ∞Ê†ºÂºèÂåñÊñáÊú¨‰ª•Â°´ÂÖÖÊÆµËêΩÁöÑÂäüËÉΩÔºå‰ΩÜÂπ∂ÈùûÊâÄÊúâÁöÑÁºñËæëÂô®ÈÉΩËøôÊ†∑ÂÅö„ÄÇËøôÂ∞±ÊòØ Linux¬†fmt¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§ÁöÑÁî®Ê≠¶‰πãÂú∞„ÄÇ

‰ΩøÁî® Linux fmt ÂëΩ‰ª§Ê†ºÂºèÂåñÊñáÊú¨

fmt¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑÊñáÊú¨Ê†ºÂºèÂåñÁ®ãÂ∫èÔºõÂÆÉÊî∂ÈõÜÂçïËØçÂπ∂Â°´ÂÖÖÊÆµËêΩÔºå‰ΩÜ‰∏çÂ∫îÁî®‰ªª‰ΩïÂÖ∂ÂÆÉÊñáÊú¨Ê†∑ÂºèÔºå‰æãÂ¶ÇÊñú‰ΩìÊàñÁ≤ó‰Ωì„ÄÇËøô‰∏ÄÂàáÈÉΩÊòØÁ∫ØÊñáÊú¨„ÄÇ‰ΩøÁî®¬†fmt¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§Ôºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•Âø´ÈÄüË∞ÉÊï¥ÊñáÊú¨Ôºå‰ΩøÂÖ∂Êõ¥Êòì‰∫éÈòÖËØª„ÄÇËÆ©Êàë‰ª¨‰ªéËøô‰∏™ÁÜüÊÇâÁöÑÁ§∫‰æãÊñáÊú¨ÂºÄÂßã:

frontier. These are the voyages
of the starship Enterprise. Its

‰ªé .deb Êñá‰ª∂ÂÆâË£ÖÂ∫îÁî®¬†ÈùûÂ∏∏ÁÆÄÂçï„ÄÇÂèåÂáªÂÆÉÔºåÂÆÉ‰ºöÂú®ËΩØ‰ª∂‰∏≠ÂøÉ‰∏≠ÊâìÂºÄÔºåÁÑ∂Âêé‰ªéÈÇ£ÈáåÂÆâË£ÖÂÆÉ„ÄÇ

‰ΩÜÊòØÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂú® Ubuntu Êàñ Debian ‰∏≠Âç∏ËΩΩ deb ÂåÖÂë¢ÔºüÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂà†Èô§‰∏ÄÊÆµÊó∂Èó¥ÂâçÂÆâË£ÖÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÂë¢„ÄÇ

ËôΩÁÑ∂ËøôÊúâÂá†‰∏™Â¶ÇÊûúÂíå‰ΩÜÊòØÔºå‰ΩÜÂà†Èô§ .deb Êñá‰ª∂ÁöÑÊúÄÁÆÄÂçïÂíåÊúÄÂèØÈù†ÁöÑÊñπÊ≥ïÊòØ‰ΩøÁî®¬†apt remove¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§„ÄÇ

sudo apt remove program_name


Â¶Ç‰Ω†ÊâÄËßÅÔºå‰Ω†ÈúÄË¶ÅÂú®ËøôÈáåÁü•ÈÅìÁ°ÆÂàáÁöÑÂåÖÂêçÁß∞„ÄÇËøôÂèØËÉΩÂπ∂‰∏çÊÄªÊòØÊòæËÄåÊòìËßÅÁöÑ„ÄÇ‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†Âú® Ubuntu ‰∏äÂÆâË£Ö Google ChromeÔºåÂàôËØ•Á®ãÂ∫èÂú®ÂëΩ‰ª§Ë°å‰∏≠Áß∞‰∏∫ ‚Äúgoogle-chrome-stable‚Äù„ÄÇ‰Ω†Â∑≤ÁªèÁü•ÈÅì‰∫ÜÂêóÔºüÊàëÁåú‰Ω†‰∏çÁü•ÈÅì„ÄÇ

Âú®Êú¨ÊïôÁ®ã‰∏≠ÔºåÊàëÂ∞ÜËØ¶ÁªÜ‰ªãÁªçÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÊâæÂà∞Á°ÆÂàáÁöÑÂåÖÂêçÁß∞ÔºåÁÑ∂Âêé‰ΩøÁî®ÂÆÉÊù•Âà†Èô§Â∫îÁî®„ÄÇÊàëËøòÂ∞ÜËÆ®ËÆ∫‰ΩøÁî®ÂõæÂΩ¢ÊñπÊ≥ïÂà†Èô§ deb ÂåÖ„ÄÇ

‰ªé Ubuntu ‰∏≠Âà†Èô§ÈÄöËøá .deb Êñá‰ª∂ÂÆâË£ÖÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖ

Âú®ÊàëÂêë‰Ω†Â±ïÁ§∫Â¶Ç‰Ωï‰ªéÂëΩ‰ª§Ë°åÂà†Èô§ deb ÂåÖ‰πãÂâçÔºåËÆ©Êàë‰ª¨Âú®ËΩØ‰ª∂‰∏≠ÂøÉÂ∫îÁî®‰∏≠Âø´ÈÄüÊü•ÁúãÂÆÉ„ÄÇ

ÊñπÊ≥ï 1ÔºöÊ£ÄÊü•Â∫îÁî®ÊòØÂê¶ÂèØ‰ª•‰ªéËΩØ‰ª∂‰∏≠ÂøÉÁßªÈô§

Ubuntu ÊúâËΩØ‰ª∂‰∏≠ÂøÉ GUI Â∫îÁî®ÔºåÂÖÅËÆ∏ÊêúÁ¥¢„ÄÅÂÆâË£ÖÂíåÂà†Èô§Â∫îÁî®„ÄÇ

ÊêúÁ¥¢Êó∂ÔºåËΩØ‰ª∂‰∏≠ÂøÉÂèØËÉΩ‰∏ç‰ºöÊòæÁ§∫Â∑≤ÂÆâË£ÖÁöÑÂ∫îÁî®„ÄÇ



‰ΩÜÊòØÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂêë‰∏ãÊªöÂä®Ôºå‰Ω†‰ªçÂèØËÉΩÂú®‚ÄúÂ∑≤ÂÆâË£Ö‚ÄùÈÉ®ÂàÜ‰∏ãÊâæÂà∞ÂÆÉ„ÄÇÂ§ñÈÉ®Â∫îÁî®ÈÄöÂ∏∏‰∏çÂ∏¶ÂæΩÊ†áÊòæÁ§∫„ÄÇ



Â¶ÇÊûúÊâæÂà∞ÂÆÉÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøáÂçïÂáª‚ÄúÂûÉÂúæÊ°∂‚ÄùÂõæÊ†áÊàñ‚ÄúÂà†Èô§‚ÄùÊåâÈíÆÊù•Âà†Èô§ËØ•Â∫îÁî®„ÄÇ



‰∏ÄÂè•ËØùÔºöÊ£ÄÊü•ÊòØÂê¶ÂèØ‰ª•‰ªéËΩØ‰ª∂‰∏≠ÂøÉÂà†Èô§Â∫îÁî®„ÄÇ

ÊñπÊ≥ï 2Ôºö‰ΩøÁî® apt ÂëΩ‰ª§Âà†Èô§Â∫îÁî®

ÊàëÂÅáËÆæ‰Ω†‰∏çÁü•ÈÅìËØ•Â∫îÁî®ÂëΩ‰ª§ÁöÑÁ°ÆÂàáÂêçÁß∞„ÄÇ‰Ω†ÂèØËÉΩ‰∏çÁü•ÈÅì Google Chrome ÂÆâË£Ö‰∏∫ google-chrome-stable ËÄå Edge ÂÆâË£Ö‰∏∫ microsoft-edge-stableÔºåËøôÂæàÊ≠£Â∏∏„ÄÇ

Â¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†Áü•ÈÅìÂâçÂá†‰∏™Â≠óÊØçÔºåÈÇ£‰πà tab Ë°•ÂÖ®ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÊúâÊâÄÂ∏ÆÂä©„ÄÇÂê¶ÂàôÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•¬†‰ΩøÁî® apt ÂëΩ‰ª§ÂàóÂá∫Â∑≤ÂÆâË£ÖÁöÑÂ∫îÁî®¬†Âπ∂‰ΩøÁî®¬†grep¬†ÊêúÁ¥¢Â∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫èÂêçÁß∞Ôºö

‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•Êô∫ËÉΩÂú∞ÁåúÊµã Google Chrome ÂåÖÁöÑÂêçÁß∞‰∏≠Â∫îËØ•ÂåÖÂê´ chrome„ÄÇ‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•ËøôÊ†∑ÊêúÁ¥¢Ôºö

Âú®Êüê‰∫õÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÂæóÂà∞Â§ö‰∏™ÁªìÊûú„ÄÇ



Â¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†‰∏çÁ°ÆÂÆöËøô‰∫õËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÁöÑ‰ΩúÁî®Ôºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•ÈöèÊó∂ÈÄöËøá‰ª•‰∏ãÊñπÂºèËé∑ÂèñÂÆÉ‰ª¨ÁöÑËØ¶ÁªÜ‰ø°ÊÅØÔºö

Ëé∑ÂæóÁ°ÆÂàáÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÂêçÁß∞ÂêéÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®¬†apt remove¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§Â∞ÜÂÖ∂Âà†Èô§„ÄÇ

articles.author: David Both
articles.description:
A sysadmin's guide to network interface configuration files
David Both
Wed, 08/03/2022 - 03:00

    
Register or Login to like
Register or Login to like
In the first article of this series, Get started with NetworkManager on Linux,¬†I looked at what NetworkManager does and some of the tools it provides for viewing network connections and devices. I discussed using the nmcli command to view the status of network devices and connections on a host. I also mentioned that NetworkManager does not need interface configuration files for most hosts. However, it can create its own INI-style connection configuration files, and it recognizes the older and now deprecated network interface configuration files.
This article explores three questions:
Why do I not use interface configuration files?
Why do I‚Ä¶
articles.title: A sysadmin's guide to network interface configuration files

articles.author: Jim Hall
articles.description:
How I use the Linux sed command to automate file edits
Jim Hall
Tue, 08/02/2022 - 03:00

    
4 readers like this
4 readers like this
When I use the Linux command line, whether I'm writing a new program on my desktop computer or managing a website on my web server, I often need to process text files. Linux provides powerful tools that I leverage to get my work done. I frequently use sed, an editor that can modify text according to a pattern.
sed stands for stream editor, and it edits text in a file and prints the results. One way to use sed is to identify several occurrences of one string in a file and replace them with a different string. You can use sed to process text files to a seemingly endless degree, but I'd like to share a few ways I use sed to help me manage files.
Search and repl‚Ä¶
articles.title: How I use the Linux sed command to automate file edits

articles.author: David Both
articles.description:
How I disabled IPv6 on Linux
David Both
Mon, 08/01/2022 - 03:00

    
3 readers like this
3 readers like this
IPv6 is a good thing for the Internet in general, but I find it unnecessarily complex for use in most home and small- to medium-size businesses. Like many others, I continue to use private IPv4 address ranges for my own internal networks and those for which I have some level of responsibility. My ISP only provides IPv4 addresses anyway, so it makes no sense to use IPv6 internally when all external packets are IPv4. Besides, IPv4 is much simpler, and one of my Linux Philosophy tenets is "Find the Simplicity."
As a result, I disabled IPv6 on all my hosts. It seemed easy‚Äîat first. Here is how I did it.

More Linux resources
Linux commands cheat sheet
Advanced Linux commands cheat shee‚Ä¶
articles.title: How I disabled IPv6 on Linux

articles.author: Ben Cotton
articles.description:
Why program management matters in open source
Ben Cotton
Mon, 08/01/2022 - 03:00

    
2 readers like this
2 readers like this
Everyone does program management. Some just do it poorly.
I've used that line for a laugh at the beginning of talks, but it's true. Program management is, at its core, the act of coordinating the interfaces between teams to produce something of value. In open source projects, the "something of value" is generally the software that the community produces. Most open source communities create software, and almost none of them have a formal program manager. So why have a program manager?
The difference lies in managing the software development with intent instead of by accident. The smaller the community, the easier it is to self-coordinate. The need for intentional co‚Ä¶
articles.title: Why program management matters in open source

articles.author: Gaurav Kamathe
articles.description:
Learn Rust by debugging Rust
Gaurav Kamathe
Fri, 07/29/2022 - 03:00

    
1 reader likes this
1 reader likes this
In my previous¬†article about rustup, I showed you how to install the Rust toolchain. Well, what good is the toolchain if you won‚Äôt be using it to get more hands-on with Rust? Learning any language involves reading existing code and writing a lot of sample programs. That's a good way to become proficient in a language. However, there's a third way: debugging code.
Learning through debugging involves trying to compile a pre-written (buggy) sample program, understanding the errors generated by the compiler, fixing the sample code, and then re-compiling it. Repeat that process until the code successfully compiles and runs.
Rustlings is an open source project by the Rust team that h‚Ä¶
articles.title: Learn Rust by debugging Rust

articles.author: Evan "Hippy" Slatis
articles.description:
Fix bugs in Bash scripts by printing a stack trace
Evan "Hippy" Slatis
Fri, 07/29/2022 - 03:00

    
4 readers like this
4 readers like this
No one wants to write bad code, but inevitably bugs will be created. Most modern languages like Java, JavaScript, Python, etc., automatically print a stack trace when they encounter an unhandled exception, but not shell scripts. It would make it much easier to find and fix bugs in shell scripts if you could print a stack trace, and, with a little work, you can.
Shell scripts can span multiple files, and well-written code is further broken down into functions. Tracing issues when something goes wrong in a shell script can be difficult when these scripts get large enough. A stack trace that walks the code backward from the error to the beginning can sho‚Ä¶
articles.title: Fix bugs in Bash scripts by printing a stack trace

articles.author: Jim Hall
articles.description:
Use this nifty Unix tool to process text on Linux
Jim Hall
Thu, 07/28/2022 - 03:00

    
3 readers like this
3 readers like this
Unix has always excelled at processing text, and Linux is no different. And the tools to work with and transform text files still exist on all Linux systems.
Like other computer systems, early Unix printed on paper, using a typewriter-style printing device. These printers provided limited formatting options, but with clever application of Unix tools, you could prepare professional-looking documents.
One such tool was the pr tool, to prepare text documents for printing. Let's explore how to use standard Unix tools, such as the pr processor and the fmt text formatter, to prepare text files for printing on a typewriter-style printer.
[ Read also:¬†How I use the Linux‚Ä¶
articles.title: Use this nifty Unix tool to process text on Linux

articles.author: Jim Hall
articles.description:
How I manage files from the Linux command line
Jim Hall
Wed, 07/27/2022 - 03:00

    
4 readers like this
4 readers like this
Managing files in a graphical desktop like GNOME or KDE is an exercise in point-and-click. To move a file into a folder, you click and drag the icon to its new home. To remove a file, you drag it into the ‚ÄúTrash‚Äù icon. The graphical interface makes desktop computing easy to use.
But we don't always interact with Linux systems with a graphical interface. If you work on a server, you likely need to use the command line to get around. Even desktop users like me might prefer to interact with their system through a terminal and command line. I tend to rely on a few commands to manage my files from the command line:
List files with Linux ls
For anyone who uses the command‚Ä¶
articles.title: How I manage files from the Linux command line

articles.author: Anderson Silva
articles.description:
My honest review of the HP Dev One
Anderson Silva
Wed, 07/27/2022 - 03:00

    
5 readers like this
5 readers like this
A few weeks ago, HP joined the bandwagon of major laptop manufacturers releasing a Linux-based laptop, the HP Dev One. The brand joins others such as Lenovo and Dell, offering a laptop with a pre-installed distribution of Linux in the US market. HP joined forces with smaller Linux-based laptop brand System76 to pre-install Pop!_OS as their distribution of choice on the device. Pop!_OS is a Ubuntu-based distribution, which System76 started (and is currently the primary maintainer) to maximize the features of its own laptops sold on its website.
This article is a quick look at the HP Dev One, including first impressions of the hardware itself and running the pre-installed P‚Ä¶
articles.title: My honest review of the HP Dev One

articles.author: Jim Hall
articles.description:
How I use Bash to automate tasks on Linux
Jim Hall
Tue, 07/26/2022 - 03:00

    
9 readers like this
9 readers like this
The Bash command line is a great way to automate tasks. Whether you are running Linux on a server and need to manipulate log files or other data, or you're a desktop user who just wants to keep files tidy, you can use a few automation features in Bash to make your work easier.
Linux for command: Automate tasks on a files
If you have a bunch of files to work on at once, and you need to do the same thing with every file, use the for command. This command iterates across a list of files, and executes one or more commands. The for command looks like this:
for variable in list
do
done

I've added some extra spacing in there to help separate the different parts of the for comm‚Ä¶
articles.title: How I use Bash to automate tasks on Linux

articles.description:
‚ÄúWhat is dead may never die.‚Äù Much like a White Walker in Game of Thrones, Internet Explorer joins the ranks of the undead that are determined to wreak havoc on humanity. Microsoft tamed the Internet Explorer beast in Windows 11, preventing anyone from summoning it and running its ancient code, but now one dastardly Twitter user has broken Internet Explorer‚Äôs chains and set it free to run freely on Windows 11.
Internet Explorer was never supposed to work on Windows 11. Microsoft disabled IE in Windows 11, making it the first version of Windows without IE for more than 20 years. In fact, if you even try to launch Internet Explorer in Windows 11, the OS simply forces you into Microsoft Edge.
you thought Internet Explorer was dead, didn't...

articles.description:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
    

  
Hackers have targeted the Solana ecosystem, draining crypto funds from thousands of connected wallets. Such attacks are common among blockchain platforms, but the news is still significant given the praise Solana has attracted as one of the faster and cheaper ecosystems for trading digital assets.
Solana‚Äôs official Twitter account said that approximately 7,767 wallets had been affected by the attack, including those operated by third-parties Phantom and Slope. The company did not explain the cause of the attack, but noted that there was no evidence that hardware wallets (those not connected to the internet) had been affected.
‚ÄúEngineers are currently working with multiple security researchers and ecosystem teams to identify the root...

articles.title: Solana ecosystem hit by widespread hack draining thousands of crypto wallets

Amidst a disappointing set of earnings for the last quarter, Match Group has announced it‚Äôs scaling back Tinder‚Äôs metaverse dating ambitions and scrapping plans to offer an in-app Tinder Coins currency. Tinder CEO Renate Nyborg, who became the dating app‚Äôs first female CEO just last September, is also leaving the position, parent company Match Group‚Äôs CEO Bernard Kim announced. Kim himself was named as CEO just two months ago. 
Nyborg previously set out ambitious plans for Tinder‚Äôs take on the metaverse (or ‚ÄúTinderverse‚Äù as she called it). Tinder acquired a company called Hyperconnect last year, which focuses on video, AI, and augmented reality technology, and Nyborg later cited its avatar-based ‚ÄúSingle Town‚Äù experience as a way Tinder‚Äôs...

Ford says it has delivered F-150 Lightning electric truck ‚Äî which is totally sold out in the US for 2022 ‚Äî to customers in all 50 states, including Alaska and Hawaii. 
It‚Äôs a nice, if not exactly important, milestone and a feather in Ford‚Äôs cap as it seeks to ramp up production and deliveries of its flagship electric vehicle. And it all happened in the span of two months, which Ford deems ‚Äúlightning quick.‚Äù
‚Äúlightning quick‚Äù
Ford is counting on its 119 years of production and delivery expertise as well as its vast network of dealerships as it seeks to vault over its rivals in the race to get electric trucks to the most people. Trucks are among the top-selling vehicles in the country, and the F-150 has been the best-selling vehicle in the...

articles.description:
Illustrations by Alex Castro / The Verge
    

  
Nintendo continues to struggle to hit its Switch production targets as a result of the global chip shortage, which contributed to a near 23 percent decline in console sales to 3.43 million in the three months ending June 30th, the company reported today. 
Sales of the standard Nintendo Switch were down 60 percent to 1.32 million units in the quarter, while sales of the Switch Lite were down nearly 50 percent to 0.59 million. The Switch OLED, which only went on sale last October, made up some of the shortfall with 1.52 million units sold. Software sales were also down by 8.6 percent to a little under 41.5 million units. The company still expects to sell 21 million consoles throughout the course of its year ending March 2023.
‚ÄúProduction...

articles.title: Sales of Nintendo‚Äôs Switch dip as chip shortage continues to bite

Blake Masters, protege to billionaire tech investor Peter Thiel, has won the Arizona‚Äôs Republican nomination for US Senate late Tuesday night, the Associated Press and New York Times are reporting. 
Masters‚Äô triumph over solar power executive Jim Lamon installs the Trump-endorsed candidate as the GOP‚Äôs choice to take on former NASA astronaut Sen. Mark Kelly (D) this fall. Arizona is one of a handful of toss-up races that could decide which party controls the Senate come November. 
Prior to Masters‚Äô campaign announcement last summer, Politico reported that controversial tech investor Thiel funneled millions into the new Saving Arizona PAC in anticipation of his pupil‚Äôs Senate race. Thiel has donated at least $15 million to the PAC as of...

Some Michigan counties can‚Äôt immediately report Tuesday night‚Äôs election results due to a confusing mix of federal vote reporting guidance and AT&T‚Äôs decision to retire its 3G networks this past February.
In a website alert, the Wayne County clerk‚Äôs office confirmed that 65 of Michigan‚Äôs 83 total counties ‚Äúare no longer modeming unofficial election results.‚Äù Wayne County is where Detroit is located, and it‚Äôs the state‚Äôs biggest county by population, with about 1.8 million residents. It‚Äôs unclear how many are due to county officials that did not upgrade their own modems, or if this is due to U.S. Election Assistance Commission (EAC) guidelines advising against using modems.

articles.description:
Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The Verge
    

  
A jury has found Argishti Khudaverdyan, a former owner of a T-Mobile store, guilty of using stolen credentials to unlock ‚Äúhundreds of thousands of cellphones‚Äù from August 2014 to June 2019 (via PCMag). According to a press release from the Department of Justice and an indictment filed earlier this year, Khudaverdyan made around $25 million from the scheme, which also involved bypassing carrier blocks put on lost or stolen cell phones.
For years, he reportedly used several tactics to acquire the T-Mobile employee credentials needed to unlock phones, including phishing, social engineering, and even getting the carrier‚Äôs IT department to reset higher-ups‚Äô passwords, giving him access. The DOJ says he accessed over 50 employees‚Äô credentials,...

articles.description:
The Sonos Roam launched last year is now available in refurbished condition for $139. | Photo by Chris Welch / The Verge
    

  
Most would agree that Sonos offers some of the best speakers and soundbars currently available. That‚Äôs because Sonos makes speakers that ‚Äî more often than not ‚Äî boast great sound quality, support for all the major streaming platforms, and simple multi-room functionality. Unfortunately, however, those perks often come at a high price. Sonos products aren‚Äôt cheap, and, outside of the occasional rogue discount, they rarely go on sale. However, that doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean there aren‚Äôt ways to save at least a few dollars on Sonos gear.
If you‚Äôre comfortable buying refurbished, for example, you could save a decent amount. We also occasionally see sales on Sonos‚Äô collaborative series with Ikea and discounted bundles that include Sonos...

articles.description:
Kratos, God of Warning. | Image: War Gods Zeus of Child‚Äôs Xbox Store listing
    

  
The big God of War sequel is one of the year‚Äôs most anticipated video games, and you can now play it on Xbox. Yes, that‚Äôs right, War Gods Zeus of Child, which stars Sony‚Äôs video game character Kratos and a horde of identical and generic monster baddies, is currently available for just $4.09 on the Xbox store.
Oh, you thought I was talking about a different game? Nope, War Gods Zeus of Child is definitely an approved and legitimate entry in one of Sony‚Äôs most valuable franchises being sold on a competing console platform.
I promise you‚Äôll want to play it just based on the game‚Äôs description:
War Gods Zeus of Child is a great war game. Destroy all enemies and creatures with the Zeus War Gods of challange [sic]. Kill them all with your gun....

  
Continue reading‚Ä¶

Drawing on the microclimate of the vineyard, the studio constructed the mosaic of translucent and transparent panels using meteorological measurements of solar radiance, wind intensity, temperature, and humidity. More

articles.description: In The Netherlands in the 17th Century, a Golden Age was in full swing. The economy of the Dutch Republic, as it was then known, was flourishing as Antwerp and other ports became important hubs for the commercial shipping trade, importing and exporting textiles, spices, and metals, and the cities‚Äô populations swelled. Elaborately detailed oil paintings depicting food on the table or incredible flower arrangements were popular additions to wealthy merchants‚Äô homes, yet a more ominous genre of still-life painting also emerged amid this period of immense growth. articles.author: Paulette Beete
articles.description:
In some ways, Caledonia Curry‚Äôs work as a public artist has come full circle, an evolution she discusses in a new interview supported by Colossal Members. Curry debuted as a New York City street artist known as Swoon right around the turn of the last century, her hand-worked portraits making striking, albeit illegal, statements on old walls. Today, she harnesses that same energy into intricate‚Äîand intimate‚Äîinstallations set in museums and galleries.
When I look at a face for days, when I take a portrait of somebody on the street, and then I stare at that face for days and days, there‚Äôs this part of my brain that‚Äôs like, ‚ÄúThis human is utterly perfect.
 More
articles.title: Interview: Swoon Speaks to Finding Compassion Through the Act of Looking and Unearthing Her Own Vulnerability

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: On vintage ledgers and notebooks, artist Albert Chamillard (previously) harnesses the power of crosshatching and simple outlines to render flat, geometric shapes that appear to emerge from the page. The meditative works utilize varying densities to add depth and volume to clusters of cylinders or undulating, ribbon-like forms. By rendering each piece in a monochromatic palette of black or red, the artist draws attention to the meticulously laid lines and deceptive dimension of the forms. More
articles.title: Dense Cross-Hatching Adds Deceptive Volume to Albert Chamillard‚Äôs Geometric Drawings
